text: A <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - associated signaling pathway leading to cytokine gene transcription and T cell proliferation without TCR engagement .

Stimulation of resting human T cells with the <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - specific mAb BW 828 induces proliferation and cytokine synthesis without further requirement for TCR coengagement .
This observation prompted us to postulate that signal 2 ( costimulatory signal ) alone without signal 1 ( TCR signal ) can activate T cells .

To test whether this putative function of <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is mediated via a particular signaling pathway , we compared early signaling events initiated in resting T cells by the stimulatory mAb BW 828 with signals triggered by the nonstimulating <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mAb 9.3 .

Stimulation of T cells with BW 828 induced an increase in intracellular Ca2+ , but did not lead to detectable activation of the protein kinases <extra_id_0> p56(lck) <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> c-Raf-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: This pathway resulted in the induction of the transcription factors NF-kappa B , NF-AT , and proteins binding to the <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> response element of the <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter .

On the other hand , stimulation of T cells with mAb 9.3 increased the level of intracellular Ca2+ and triggered the activation of <extra_id_0> p56(lck) <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> c-Raf-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , but was unable to induce the binding of transcription factors to the <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter .

text: In contrast to the differential signaling of <extra_id_0> BW 828 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> 9.3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in resting T cells , the two mAbs exhibited a similar pattern of early signaling events in activated T cells and Jurkat cells ( <extra_id_0> p56(lck) <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activation , association of phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase with <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , indicating that the signaling capacity of <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> changes with activation .

text: These data support the view that stimulation through <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> can induce some effector functions in T cells and suggest that this capacity is associated with a particular pattern of early signaling events .
